Skeleton Screens

“A Skeleton screen is essentially a blank version of a page into which information is gradually loaded” - LW

Skeletons screens provide an alternative to traditional spinners or loaders because, as they make users focus on progress instead of wait times, they create anticipation of what is going on and help to reduce users’ cognitive load.

The use of Skeleton screens that gradually fill up, guides users to focus more on the content being loaded rather than on the fact that the screen is loading and that they have to wait for it.

Skeleton Interaction

Skeletons should have a gradually fade in and fade out transition while the content is being loaded in the screen.

Layer #1

After user enters to a section, a blank screen should appear. The header, footer and sidebar are displayed normally.

Layer #2

In less than a second, the skeleton screen should fade in gradually.

Layer #3

The skeleton should be replaced while the screen starts being populated by content.

Layer #4

The final UI should be completely loaded.
